intro: Metastelma minutiflorum, commonly known as the dwarf starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other genera such as Oncidium and Epilobium. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
